name: Stobhach Gaelach (Irish Stew)
description: A traditional Irish stew made with lamb, potatoes, and hearty vegetables.

main.notes: cut into chunks, can use beef as an alternative

details: Trim excess fat from the lamb or mutton chunks.
Optional: Brown the meat in a large pot with butter for extra flavor.
In a large pot, layer half of the potatoes on the bottom.
Add the meat on top, followed by the carrots, onions, parsnips, and turnips (if using).
Add bay leaves and thyme to the pot.
Pour in enough stock to just cover the ingredients.
Bring the pot to a gentle boil over medium heat.
Reduce to a simmer, cover, and cook for 2â€“3 hours.
Stir occasionally and check that the potatoes and meat are tender.
Taste the stew and adjust seasoning with salt and black pepper.
Optional: Remove bay leaves and thyme sprigs before serving.
Garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.
Serve hot with crusty bread or soda bread on the side.
